column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=2.
#Text=Typical Ligands for Bile Acids
#Text=BA targeted therapy is based on their receptors and ligands .

#Text=The regulation of BAs on other pathways occurs mainly through the activation of nuclear hormone receptors ( NHRs ) such as the farnesoid X receptor ( FXR ) , pregnane X receptor ( PXR ) , and vitamin D receptor ( VDR ) .
#Text=For the activation of these receptors , it is necessary that they interact with the retinoid X receptor as a heterodimer ( RXR ) .
#Text=Afterwards , they act on various regulatory regions by binding to hormone response elements causing several genes to be up or downregulated in their transcription .
#Text=Most BAs and the secondary BA , and LCA , are binding to FXR and PXR respectively .
#Text=2.1 .
#Text=FXR
#Text=FXR plays an important role in BA , glucose , and lipid metabolism .
#Text=It is most highly expressed in the liver , ileum , kidneys , and adrenal glands .
#Text=The strongest activator is CDCA , followed by DCA , CA , and LCA .
#Text=Despite the fact that LCA is a weak activator of FXR , it is a very strong downregulator of its function and thus could be termed a partial agonist .
#Text=Controlling the synthesis and enterohepatic circulation of BAs , represents the major function of FXR .
#Text=In the liver , bile flow is prompted through FXR activation .

#Text=After being activated through BA in the ileum , the expression of fibroblast growth factor 15/19 ( FGF15/19 ) increases , leading to an activation of fibroblast growth factor receptor 4 ( FGFR4 ) in hepatocytes (
#Text=Figure 1
#Text=) .
#Text=This is of great importance as FGF15/19 is an ileum-derived enterokine that governs BA homeostasis , regulates hepatic glucose metabolism , and stimulates protein synthesis .
#Text=If administered pharmacologically or expressed transgenically in mice , FGF19 increases hepatic lipid oxidation , reduces lipogenesis and protects from hepatosteatosis .
#Text=A lack of it causes impaired liver regeneration .
#Text=A lack of FGF 15 results in increased hepatic steatosis and in the development of endoplasmic reticulum ( ER ) stress in the liver of mice fed a high fat diet .
#Text=The activation of FGFR4 together with the activation of small heterodimer partner ( SHP ) in the liver , inhibits CYP7A1 .
#Text=In order to downregulate CYP7A1 , intestinal-specific FXR is required .
#Text=On the other hand , the liver-specific FXR plays an important role in the repression of the expression of CYP8B1 .
#Text=One of the mechanisms for BAs to suppress their own synthesis is through FXR .
#Text=FXR influences the hepatic lipid homeostasis via SHP , which reduces the expression of SREBP1 .
#Text=It also regulates the expression of peroxisome proliferator-activated receptor PPAR-α , a regulator of triglyceride metabolism , that can induce free fatty acid β-oxidation .
#Text=2.2 .
#Text=Takeda G-Protein-Coupled Receptor 5 ( TGR5 )
#Text=TGR5 is a G-protein coupled membrane receptor that BAs activate .
#Text=LCA is considered to be the strongest activator of TGR5 among the main primary and secondary BAs .
#Text=It is widely expressed in the body , for example in the gallbladder , ileum , colon , liver ( not in hepatocytes though ) , brown adipose tissue ( BAT ) , nervous system , and muscle .

#Text=Besides being involved in BA , glucose , and lipid metabolism , interestingly , it also plays a role in increasing the induction of BAT expression in thermogenesis and energy release via browning of white adipose tissue and .

#Text=TGR5 knockout leads to a changed BA composition and has anti-inflammatory properties by for example by inhibiting nuclear factor kappa-light-chain-enhancer of activated B cells ( NF-κB ) or LPS-induced production of inflammatory cytokines in macrophages .

#Text=In another experiment , TGR5 knockout mice received a sleeve gastrectomy and it was shown how TGR5 is important in order to decrease hepatic steatosis , improve glucose control , and increase the energy expenditure post-surgery .
